intro: Jacquemontia sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, rounded, globe-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-like blooms that open in the morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The species is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other climbing and trailing plants.
